text:
It'd be interesting to know if this is for the instagram crowd or if it's the perspective of one who's tried them all.
Of course, each to their own. But Oppio, to me, is a tourist trap. As is Fortunata. I find Pompi better than 2 sizes. Have you tried some of the places around Centocelle? O forse Don Bosco? Oppure Monte Mario? Mah, forse la domanda sara` troppo dificile.

text: I’m Going to Rome next month and would love to pull at your strings to share them with me.
author: @melissamendes9295

text: What are some good ones
author: @dylanallen5653

text:
@dylanallen5653 , I not going to re-watch the video now, but if you’re looking for some recommendations, I’d suggest the following: 
Restaurants (reasonable) 
1. L’Elementare (Roman style pizza) 
2. Seu Pizza Illuminati (Napolitana style pizza) 
3. 50 Kalò (Napolitana style pizza) 
Also for pizza, there is Bonci, as I mentioned before, but do yourself a favor and go to the panificio so you don’t have to queue for ages. 
4. Osteria Chiana 
5. Pro Loco Pinciano 
6. Eggs 
7. Checchino 
8. Romanè 
9. Luciano 
10. Armando 
11. Da Danilo 
Restaurants (moderate spend) 
1. Roscioli 
2. PierLuigi 
3. Retrobottega 
Restaurants (splurge) 
1. Antico Arco 
2. Pulejo 
3. La Pergola 
Bars 
1. Freni e Frizioni 
2. Jerry Thomas Speakeasy 
3. Hotel Ruse courtyard bar 
4. Vinoteca Angelini (for spritzes) 
Gelato 
1. Iomotti 
2. La Romana 
3. Old Bridge 
4. Del Teatro 
5. Otaleg 
6. Giolitti (fruit flavours only) 
7. Manny’s 
Enjoy
author: @LeMagnifiqueDoubleAgent-cj4zo

text: @LeMagnifiqueDoubleAgent-cj4zo  are you from rome
author: @dylanallen5653

text: @dylanallen5653 , I’m not from Rome, but I lived there for quite a while up until September 2023 so the recommendations should still be pretty valid (especially the pizza and gelato ones)
author: @LeMagnifiqueDoubleAgent-cj4zo

text: @LeMagnifiqueDoubleAgent-cj4zo  ahh got it thanks? So those are all good local spots? Also are there any unsafe spots not to walk around you would avoid?
author: @dylanallen5653

text: @dylanallen5653 , Sure. I would say the pizzerias are local spots apart from Seu Pizza Illuminati. It’s quite famous now and gets tourists, but locals do go there too. Bonci is very famous, but it will be almost certainly locals if you go to the panificio and not the pizzarium, which is almost exclusively tourists now (especially this time of the year). All of the reasonable spend restaurants are going to be mostly locals apart from Armando’s. In the moderate range, Roscioli is very touristy now, but the products are genuinely excellent. If you are going to be there within the next month and don’t have a reservation, you almost certainly will not get in, but you can go to the caffe a few doors away. They don’t have the same menu though. The bars will be a mix. Of course the hotel bar will be mostly tourists, but locals will go there for a nicer place. Of them all, Angelini is the most local apart from the tourists who are staying in the neighbourhood. Almost all of the gelato places will be mostly tourists because I put ones that are near the sites that are good since there are lots that are not good. Locals do go to La Romana, but it would dependent on which location you choose. Iomotti is very local and a bit away from the tourist sites, but it’s my favourite so I included it. Locals will go to Giolitti because it is quite famous, but there will be lots of tourists there too since it’s pretty central to everything. Regarding safety, Rome is quite safe, but the area around Termini station can be a bit seedy so I would recommend to avoid that area at night. San Lorenzo is a artsy/hipster neighborhood so if you want to go around there, just go during the day. I hope this helps.
author: @LeMagnifiqueDoubleAgent-cj4zo
